subject: Business
title: Good Strategy, Bad Strategy
description: A 60-second lesson on Good Strategy, Bad Strategy.

hook.text: Most 'strategies' are just goals wearing a costume. 'Grow 20%' is an aspiration, not a strategy.

buildup.text: Richard Rumelt says good strategy has three parts: a diagnosis, a guiding policy, and coherent actions.

discovery.text: Bad strategy avoids hard choices. It lists goals without explaining how to achieve them.

twist.text: Companies with five 'top priorities' have no priorities. Strategy requires painful trade-offs.

climax.text: Apple in 1997 killed 70% of its products. That painful cut was the strategy that saved the company.

punchline.text: If your strategy doesn't hurt, it's probably not a strategy.

quiz.question: According to Rumelt, what makes a strategy 'bad'?
options: It lists goals without explaining how to achieve them or making trade-offs
It focuses on a single objective
